Description: The + Create Tenant and Set Password buttons on the top-right are redundant because they only open modals that are already accessible via the Create Tenant and Set Password tabs below.
Current Behavior: User can open the same modals from both the top-right buttons and the main section tabs.
Expected / Recommendation: Remove or relocate the top-right buttons to avoid duplication and reduce UI clutter. Keep a single clear entry point for each action.

Description: Set Password and Logout options are available at the bottom-left while the same actions are already accessible via the Profile icon on the top-right.
Current Behavior: Same actions are available in two different locations.
Expected / Recommendation: Keep account-related actions only under the Profile menu for consistency and better user experience.

Description: There is no show/hide (eye) icon next to the password field, making it difficult for users to verify the entered password.
Current Behavior: Password input is always masked with no option to view the entered value.
Expected / Recommendation: Add a show/hide password (eye) icon next to the password field to allow users to verify their input and reduce typing errors.

Description: The text “Open a tenant portal in a new tab” appears like a clickable action but is not interactive, which can confuse users about its purpose.
Current Behavior: Text is displayed near tenant actions but is not clickable and has no visual indication that it is informational only.
Expected / Recommendation: Either make the text clickable with proper link styling/icon, or convert it into clear helper text (e.g., tooltip or muted info text) explaining that “Visit Portal” opens in a new tab.

Current Behavior: The system shows the employee creation date instead of the entered joining date.
Expected / Recommendation: If “Joined” date represents system entry date, it should be clearly mentioned; otherwise, the system should display the actual joining date entered by the user.

Description: Very short punch duration (1 minute) is neither ignored nor properly counted
Current Behavior: Punch is recorded but worked hours remain 0h
Expected / Recommendation: Define and enforce a minimum punch duration rule (e.g., ignore <5 minutes or count as minimum unit)

Description: Leave status and attendance metrics are displayed together, causing ambiguity
Current Behavior: Leave approved and In/Out data shown simultaneously
Expected / Recommendation: Enforce a single dominant status (Leave should override attendance data)

Description: Check-in/Check-out counts do not align with worked hours
Expected / Recommendation: Ensure logical consistency between punch counts and worked hour calculation

Description: Latitude/Longitude are shown in raw format
Expected / Recommendation: Display proper address with map integration for better clarity

Description: Internal record IDs (#6, #8) are displayed next to employee codes
Current Behavior: Users see EMP-001-A • #6, EMP-002-A • #8 without explanation; may misinterpret as attendance metrics
Expected / Recommendation: Either hide internal IDs from the UI or label them clearly as “Record ID” to avoid confusion

Description: Auto-approve leave requests is a global toggle only
Current Behavior: Auto-approve applies to all leave types equally
Expected / Recommendation: Auto-approve should be configurable per leave type to allow different approval workflows

Description: Non-default Night Shift shows “0” in Schedule column instead of label or blank
Current Behavior: “0” shown after Night Shift time range
Expected / Recommendation: Show meaningful label (e.g., blank or “Non-default”) instead of “0”

Description: Profile and Apply Leave open in popups/modal
Expected / Recommendation: Should navigate to full dedicated pages for better UX and consistency
